text: The recently discovered APOBEC3 family of cytidine deaminases is considered to play an important role in antiviral intrinsic immunity ( 1 , 2 ) .

In primates , the seven paralogs <extra_id_0> APOBEC3A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> C <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> DE <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> F <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> H <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( A3A-H ) have been described ( 3 ) , and they appear to fulfill individual functions .

Human <extra_id_0> APOBEC3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , the most prominent member of the APOBEC3 family has been identified as the cellular restriction factor that is responsible for inhibition of <extra_id_0> virion infectivity factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Vif <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - deleted human immunodeficiency virus-1 ( HIV-1 ) replication in non-permissive cells ( 4 ) .

text: <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is packaged into HIV-1Delta <extra_id_0> vif <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> particles and causes C-to-U deaminations on the single-stranded viral DNA during reverse transcription ( 5-8 ) .
This leads to degradation of the uracile - containing DNA by cellular repair mechanisms or to hypermutation of the viral genome ( 5 , 6 ) .
As a result , only a marginal fraction of the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - containing HIV-1 particles is able to complete the replication cycle .

In addition to the inhibition of HIV-1 , <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> restricts replication of other lentiviruses , gammaretroviruses , deltaretroviruses , spumaviruses , long-terminal-repeat ( LTR ) - retrotransposons , orthohepadnaviruses and avihepadnaviruses ( 9-21 ) .

Interestingly , deamination seems not to be the only <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated antiviral mechanism ; in the case of hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) and human T cell leukemia virus type 1 ( HTLV-1 ) , <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was shown to restrict virus replication by deamination - independent mechanisms ( 12 , 13 , 19 , 22-25 ) .

Another member of the APOBEC3 family , <extra_id_0> APOBEC3F <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> A3F <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , appears to have similar activities like <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 26 , 27 ) .

<extra_id_0> A3F <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is also packaged into HIV-1Delta <extra_id_0> vif <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> particles and induces similar C-to-U deaminations , although the proteins differ in their target sequences specificity ( 26 , 28 ) .

Furthermore , <extra_id_0> A3F <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins were detected in many tissues that express <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and are able to form heteromultimers with <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 26 , 29 , 30 ) .

text: Both proteins localize to mRNA processing (P) bodies , cytoplasmic compartments involved in the degradation and storage of non-translating mRNAs ( 30 , 31 ) .
<extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to be expressed in T cells , a relevant cell target for HIV-1 in vivo , but little is known about its regulation ( 4 , 29 , 32 ) .

text: There is a report describing that mitogenic stimulation of T cells upregulates <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels , but this was not analyzed on the transcriptional level ( 33 ) .

text: Since the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter has not been systematically analyzed so far , our aim was to clone the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and characterize its regulation in T cells .
In our study , we observed that <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> uses multiple transcriptional start sites ( TSS ) .
By generating a series of 5 ' deletions of the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , we identified a 180 bp region that mediated basal transcription .

In T cells , transcriptional activity of this core promoter was not inducible by mitogenic stimulation or <extra_id_0> interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment , but was dependent on a GC-box which was recognized by <extra_id_0> Sp (specificity protein) 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factors .
